title: NordVPN requires Firefox reboot when switched on/off
content:
A lot of websites won't accept connections via my VPN, which I keep active all the time. So I pause NordVPN, then try again - some sites then allow access, some don't.

However... FF then seems to lose connectivity to other sites. If I resume the VPN, FF still won't connect.

So I reboot FF, wait for the "FF is already running..." message (why does this always happen? Doesn't seem to when I resort to other browsers, eg Chrome, Edge), and eventually get back on line.

So... is there any reason FF can't use a connection which has been interrupted/changed?

Anything I can do to prevent this (and also the "FF is already running..." message)?

Thanks
creator: pqvx

title: Firefox 91.0 too "buggy"
content:
Since upgrading Firefox on two platforms, I have noticed a couple of sites not working well with it. CareerBuilder.Com: When I want to upload new documents, it does not happen. I click on the button and... nothing. It works fine in MS Edge. If instead of clicking on the button, if I copy the link the button represents and paste it in the URL dialogue, it works.

Recalls.Mopar.Com: It provides a web form to enter an auto's VIN. in that dialogue web form box is the word "VIN". However it remains there and as I type the first characters of the VIN, the characters are partially obfuscated in the dialogue box by competing text, one on top of the other. After the full VIN is entered, I never get results. When I use MS Edge, the word VIN is above the web form entry box and it does not partially obfuscate the characters and when completed, results come within seconds.

Firefox Cookie Handling: There are certain malvertising sites I manually deletes cookies for. in the past versions, no problems. With v91, there are problems. In the past when I performed this function on one such site, it had two cookies according to the Cookies and Site Data data manger. With v91, there is now only one. In the past when I have deleted those cookies, the size of the Cookie Cache would not change. Now when I choose Manage Data, the size can change dramatically. Just now I did it and the Cookie Cache was ~65MB. I deleted the ONE cookie and the cache size decreased to ~42MB. But that is not all, when I visit some other sites that store configurations in a cookie, the configurations are gone and I have to reset said configurations. For example on a particular Web Forum using Invision [ IPS Community Suite version 4.6.5.1 ], Sub-Forums may be expanded or collapsed. I choose to collapse some sub-forums. That setting is stored in a cookie and exists across sessions and time. However, in FF v91, once I delete that ONE non-affiliated Cookie, that web forum's choice of collapsed sub-forums is lost. I have repeated this test numerous times and it is reproducible.

title: Fiefox will not refresh
content:
I am the church secretary and as such, I upload the Church Bulletin and Announcements to our church website once a week.

I upload the bulletin and announcements, save the changes on the church website and log off.

When I log back in to the church website using Firefox, it does not show the information that was changed and sends me to the portion of the website page that I was on when I uploaded the Bulletin and Announcements.

To verify that the uploads were successful, I must use Chrome or Edge to verify that the new uploads are properly displayed on the Church website. The uploads that I did on our church website are displayed properly on Chrome and Edge but not of Firefox

I have even run CC Cleaner and rebooted my computer and Firefox still will not display my changes. I can go to the other computer in my home, open Firefox and go to our church website and the changes that I made are there.

What steps can I take, using the computer that I used to upload the info to the church website, to verify that the the documents that I uploaded are there?

content:
